alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 2:22PM CST until December 17 at 7:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Delaware. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A frontal boundary located just south of I-40 will stall later this afternoon. Strong lift along with record precipitable water values, and the potential for training of storms will lead to a zone of heavy rainfall through tonight across the watch area. Widespread 2 inches with localized 4 inch amounts are possible. The flooding threat will begin to decrease by midnight as storms shift southeast of the region. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
